intro: Staphylea shweliensis, commonly known as the Shweli sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Hippocastanaceae family and is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The tree produces woody, spiny capsules that contain smooth, glossy seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
